member_organisations:
- British Council 
- Goethe-Institut 
- European Cultural Foundation 
- Institut français 
- Mercator Stiftung 
 
http://moreeurope.org/?q=about-us/partners
fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture, International co-operation and development, Enlargement, Youth, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations
head_office_address: avenue des Arts 58 c/o Goethe-Institut Brussels
eu_initiatives:
- Foreign Policy Instruments, in particular their Public and Cultural Diplomacy component 
- EU Global Strategy 
- public consultation on the external financing instruments of the EU, in particular the ENI 
- Creative Europe, especially its external relations elements 
- reports and initiatives by the CULT, AFET and DEV committees of the European Parliament 
- Horizon 2020 Calls for proposals "Europe as a Global Actor" 
- consultations on the next MFF
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
In 2015: 
- presentation of the results of the "Preparatory Action on Culture in EU's External Relations 2013-14" at a joint AFET-CULT meeting  
(http://moreeurope.org/?q=content/meeting-european-parliament-culture-eu-external-relations) 
- contribution to the public consultation on the review of the ENP (http://ec.europa.eu/enlargement/neighbourhood/consultation/index_en.htm) 
- participation to a conference of the Luxembourg Presidency of the EU Council, "“Culture and development: Towards a more strategic approach to cultural policies in the EU’s external relations”. 
(http://www.eu2015lu.eu/en/agenda/2015/09/03-04-conf-cult-dev/index.html) 
- production of an e-learning training for ENTRi, on intercultural competences (http://moreeurope.org/?q=content/e-learning-intercultural-competences-civilian-crisis-management) 
 
In 2016: 
- participation to the EU Culture Forum and the sessions on external cultural relations 
- contribution to the roadmap for the Joint Communication “Towards an EU strategy for international cultural relations” 
- participation to the EU Development Days and publication of an advocacy paper on the importance of culture for the EU development policies (http://moreeurope.org/?q=content/advocacy-paper-culture-eu-development-policies) 
- participation to a stakeholders' meeting of the ECoR on the Joint Communication “Towards an EU strategy for international cultural relations” 
 
In 2017: 
- contribution to the public consultation on the External Financing Instruments of the EU, on the part dedicated to the European Neighbourhood Instrument 
- organisation of a workshop with MedCulture on cultural relations with Neighbourhood South countries 
- participation to the EU Culture Forum and the sessions on the European Year of Cultural Heritage
